meanings.definition: Join together (metal pieces) by heating the edges and pressing or hammering them together.
meanings.sent1: I will weld the two metal pieces to make them one.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith used a torch to weld the metal parts together.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to weld the metal pieces but ended up sticking them to the floor instead.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to weld our hearts together in a bond of friendship.
meanings.sent5: The weld between the two metal pieces was so strong, it could not be broken.

meanings.sent1: The weld between the metal pieces was flawless.
meanings.sent2: The weld held the structure firmly in place.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her toy robot had a weld that could shoot lasers.
meanings.sent4: The weld of trust between them was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The weld on the pipe was smooth and seamless.
